medical_history.chief_complaint: Headache and altered mental status after a motor vehicle accident.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced daily headaches that developed two years before admission, worsening over several weeks. On the day of admission, she was involved in a low-speed head-on collision and was found to be disoriented, with a mild headache reported upon evaluation at the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV infection diagnosed four years prior, daily headaches developed two years before admission, previous hospitalization for aseptic meningitis with cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) analysis showing lymphocytic pleocytosis, bacterial pneumonia, mild depression, and hysterectomy due to cervical dysplasia.
medical_history.family_history: One sister died of HIV and AIDS; no other family history of neurologic disease specified.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced health care worker, occasionally drinks alcohol, did not smoke or use illicit drugs, no children, and had five sexual partners in her lifetime but was not currently sexually active.
